data.question: What is the chemical formula of the novel metal-organic framework discussed?
What are the three types of rational design proposed for introducing proton carriers into MOFs?
data.answer: Type I: Introducing them directly as counterions, Type II: Putting acid groups on frameworks, Type III: Incorporating acidic molecules into voids.

data.question: What method was used to synthesize (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
What is the superprotonic conductivity of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O at ambient temperature?
What role do water molecules play in the proton-conducting pathways of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
data.answer: Water molecules are crucial for creating the proton-conducting pathways.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O comparable to Nafion?
Does the dihydrate form of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O show higher proton conductivity than the trihydrate form?
What is the activation energy (Ea) of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
Is the proton conduction mechanism in (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O expected to be similar to the Grotthus mechanism?
Does the presence of half-occupied oxygen sites in (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O suggest a direct-jump diffusion mechanism?
What is the role of adipic acid in the structure of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
data.answer: Adipic acid provides additional protons for the proton-conducting pathways.

data.question: Is the synthesis of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O a result of combining type I and type III design concepts?
What is the yield of the synthesis process for (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
Does the crystal structure of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O include a 2-D hydrogen-bond network?
What is the significance of the short hydrogen bonds in the structure of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
data.answer: They indicate the formation of a 2-D hydrogen-bond network among various molecules, contributing to its high proton conductivity.

data.question: Was adipamide converted into adipic acid under hydrothermal conditions during the synthesis of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
What analytical technique confirmed the presence of adipic acid in (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
Does the transformation of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O from trihydrate to dihydrate form increase its proton conductivity?
What is the effect of relative humidity on the proton conductivity of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O?
data.answer: The proton conductivity decreases with lower relative humidity due to the transformation to the dihydrate form.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of (NH4)2(adp)[Zn2(ox)3]·3H2O at 25 °C under 98% RH conditions higher than at 70% RH?
